content: Synagogue in River Valley, Singapore The **Chesed-El Synagogue** ([Hebrew](/wiki/Hebrew_language): חסד-אל, [lit.](/wiki/Literal_translation) 'Grace of God') is a [Jewish](/wiki/Judaism) congregation and [synagogue](/wiki/Synagogue), located at Oxley Rise, in [River Valley](/wiki/River_Valley_Planning_Area), within the [Central Area](/wiki/Central_Area,_Singapore) of [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore). The synagogue was constructed in 1905 and in 1998 it was designated as a [national monument of Singapore](/wiki/National_monuments_of_Singapore). ## History The Chesed-El Synagogue was designated as a national monument on 18 December 1998. The synagogue underwent an extensive renovation in 2016 with the support of the [National Heritage Board](/wiki/National_Heritage_Board_(Singapore)) (NHB) of Singapore. A Jewish Community Centre was built on the synagogue grounds, where the communal [Sukkah](/wiki/Sukkah) used to stand. In 2019, the synagogue received its fourth grant from the restoration fund of the NHB for restoration and maintenance of the building. - Singapore portal - Judaism portal - [History of the Jews in Singapore](/wiki/History_of_the_Jews_in_Singapore) - List of synagogues in Singapore - Boi, Lee Geok (2004). *The Religious Monuments of Singapore*.
